revised_title: Fossil Reptilia Classification and Diademodon Discovery
tldr: The author examines the structure, organization, and classification of fossil reptiles, focusing on the newly discovered genus Diademodon. Diademodon has unique hind molar teeth with undivided roots and specialized crowns, which are distinct from other known reptiles. The author also transfers Theriodesmus from the Mammalia to the Therosuchia order based on the similarities in their forelimbs.
